title: Prepare colonisation and branching time data to run in DAISIE. — DAISIE_dataprep
code: DAISIE_dataprep(   datatable,   island_age,   M,   number_clade_types = 1,   list_type2_clades = NA,   prop_type2_pool = "proportional",   epss = 1e-05,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Prepare colonisation and branching time data to run in DAISIE. — DAISIE_dataprep
text: datatable Data frame (table) user-specified data. See file Galapagos_datatable.Rdata template input table. row table represents independent colonisation event. Table following four columns. $Clade_name - name independent colonization event $Status - One following categories:  * "Non_endemic": applies non-endemic species approximate colonisation time known  * "Non_endemic_MaxAge": applies non-endemic species cases colonisation time unknown  * "Endemic": applies endemic species endemic clades approximate colonisation time known  * "Endemic_MaxAge": applies endemic species endemic clades cases colonisation time unknown, user wants specify upper bound colonisation. example apply endemic species recently gone extinct anthropogenic causes, included phylogeny ("NA" given branching times column). also apply insular radiations long stem branches, time first cladogenetic event known, precise time colonisation .  * "Endemic_MaxAge_MinAge": Endemic_MaxAge also includes minimum age colonisation.  * "Non_endemic_MaxAge_MinAge": Non_endemic_MaxAge also includes minimum age colonisation.#'  * "Endemic&Non_Endemic": endemic clade present mainland ancestor re-colonized $Missing_species - Number island species sampled particular clade (applicable "Endemic" clades). NA given branching times column,  equal number species clade minus 1 $Branching_times  - Stem age population/species case "Non_endemic", "Non_endemic_MaxAge"  "Endemic" species extant close relatives island. Set "NA"  colonisation time unknown upper bound known. "Endemic" cladogenetic species branching times radiation, including stem age radiation (colonisation time estimate). island_age Age island appropriate units M size mainland pool, .e number species can potentially colonize island number_clade_types Number clade types. Default: number_clade_types = 1 species considered belong macroevolutionary process. number_clade_types = 2, two types clades distinct macroevolutionary processes. list_type2_clades number_clade_types = 2, list_type2_clades specifies names clades distinct macroevolutionary process. names must match $Clade_name column source data table (e.g. list_type2_clades = "Finches").  number_clade_types = 1, list_type2_clades = NA specified (default) prop_type2_pool Specifies fraction potential mainland colonists distinct macroevolutionary process. Applies number_clade_types = 2.  Default "proportional" sets fraction proportional number clades distinct macroevolutionary process colonised island. Alternatively, user can specify value 0 1 (e.g. mainland pool size 1000 prop_type2_pool = 0.02 number type2 species 20). epss Default= 1E-5 appropriate cases. value used set maximum age colonisation "Non_endemic_MaxAge" "Endemic_MaxAge" species age slightly younger island cases age provided species older island. new maximum age used upper bound integrate possible colonisation times. verbose Boolean. States intermediate results printed console. Defaults TRUE.

title: Prepare colonisation and branching time data to run in DAISIE. — DAISIE_dataprep
text: datalist R list object containing data: first element list two three components: $island_age - island age  , depending whether distinction species types made, :$not_present - number mainland lineages present island  :$not_present_type1 - number mainland lineages type 1 present island $not_present_type2 - number mainland lineages type 2 present island  following elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age stem age population/species case "Non-endemic", "Non-endemic_MaxAge" "Endemic" anagenetic species. "Endemic" cladogenetic species island age branching times radiation including stem age radiation.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4  * Endemic_MaxAge: 5 (colonisation time given)  * Endemic_MaxAge: 6 (colonisation time cladogenesis times given) $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type_1or2  - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2

title: Prepare colonisation and branching time data to run in DAISIE. — DAISIE_dataprep
text: output R list containing data formatted run DAISIE functions.

title: Wrapper function around for the DAISIE_format_CS_full_stt and DAISIE_format_CS_sampled_stt — DAISIE_format_CS
text: island_replicates List output DAISIE_sim_core_cr(), DAISIE_sim_core_time_dep(), DAISIE_sim_core_cr_shift() DAISIE_sim_min_type2() functions. Minimally, must list many elements replicates. element must list elements island_age, not_present stt_all. stt_all must data frame column names Time, nI, nA, nC present. time Numeric defining length simulation time units. example, island known 4 million years old, setting time = 4 simulate entire life span island; setting time = 2 stop simulation mid-life island. M Numeric defining size mainland pool, .e. number species can potentially colonize island. sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation. trait_pars named list containing diversification rates considering   two trait states created create_trait_pars: [1]:numeric per capita transition rate state1 [2]:numeric per capita immigration rate state2 [3]:numeric per capita extinction rate state2 [4]:numeric per capita anagenesis rate state2 [5]:numeric per capita cladogenesis rate state2 [6]:numeric per capita transition rate state2 [7]:numeric number species trait state 2    mainland

ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation.

title: Computes the loglikelihood of the DAISIE model with clade-specific diversity-dependence given data and a set of model parameters — DAISIE_loglik_CS
text: pars1 Contains model parameters: pars1[1] corresponds lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars1[2] corresponds mu (extinction rate) pars1[3] corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity) pars1[4] corresponds gamma (immigration rate) pars1[5] corresponds lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars1[6] corresponds lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) optional subset species pars1[7] corresponds mu (extinction rate) optional subset speciespars1[8] corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity) optional subset speciespars1[9] corresponds gamma (immigration rate) optional subset speciespars1[10] corresponds lambda^(anagenesis rate) optional subset speciespars1[11] corresponds p_f (fraction mainland species belongs second subset species elements 6:10 11 optional, , pars1 either contain 5, 10 11 elements. 10, fraction potential colonists type 2 computed data. 11, pars1[11] used, overruling information data. pars2 Contains model settings pars2[1] corresponds lx = length ODE variable x pars2[2] corresponds ddmodel = diversity-dependent model, model diversity-dependence, can one ddmodel = 0 : diversity dependence  ddmodel = 1 : linear dependence speciation rate  ddmodel = 11: linear dependence speciation rate immigration rate  ddmodel = 2 : exponential dependence speciation rate ddmodel = 21: exponential dependence speciation rate immigration ratepars2[3] corresponds cond = setting conditioning cond = 0 : conditioning island age  cond = 1 : conditioning island age non-extinction island biota  cond > 1 : conditioning island age least cond colonizations island pars2[4] sets whether parameters likelihood printed (1) (0) datalist Data object containing information colonisation branching times. object can generated using DAISIE_dataprep function, converts user-specified data table data object, object can course also entered directly. R list object following elements. first element list two three components: $island_age - island age  , depending whether distinction types made, :$not_present - number mainland lineages present island  :$not_present_type1 - number mainland lineages type 1 present island $not_present_type2 - number mainland lineages type 2 present island  remaining elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge Endemic anagenetic species. cladogenetic species island age branching times radiation including stem age radiation.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_Endemic: 4  * Endemic_Singleton_MaxAge: 5  * Endemic_Clade_MaxAge: 6  * Endemic&Non_Endemic_Clade_MaxAge: 7  * Non_endemic_MaxAge_MinAge: 8  * Endemic_Singleton_MaxAge_MinAge: 9 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2 methode Method ODE-solver. See package deSolve details. Default "lsodes" CS_version numeric list. Default 1 standard DAISIE model, relaxed-rate model list following elements: model: CS model run, options 1 single rate   DAISIE model, 2 multi-rate DAISIE, 0 IW test   model. relaxed_par: parameter relax (integrate ). Options "cladogenesis", "extinction", "carrying_capacity", "immigration", "anagenesis". abstolint Absolute tolerance integration reltolint Relative tolerance integration

text: total_time Numeric defining length simulation time units. area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island peak numeric value specifying peakiness (shaprness) ontogeny curve. Higher values imply peakier ontogeny. value internally calculated calc_peak() given area present area_pars. mu numeric per capita extinction rate. hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate island_ontogeny DAISIE_sim_time_dep(), DAISIE_ML_CS plotting string describing type island ontogeny. Can "const", "beta" beta function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type island ontogeny. Can 0 constant, 1 beta function describing area time. ML functions island_ontogeny = NA assumes constant ontogeny. Time dependent estimation yet available development still ongoing. return error called case. sea_level DAISIE_sim_time_dep() plotting string describing type sea level. Can "const" "sine" sine function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type sea level. Can 0 constant, 1 sine function describing area time. removed_timepoints Positive integer number first datapoints removed rate plots (prevent Inf) resolution numeric indicating resolution plot. < 0. extcutoff numeric cutoff maximum extinction rate preventing large slowing simulation.

title: DAISIE tree plot — DAISIE_plot_input
text: trees list trees, phylo format, named respective clades age age island, scale branch lengths trees. unspecified, depth deepest stem across trees. tcols vector colonization times, one value per clade. Order must `trees`. unspecified, clades assigned age island colonization time. metadata Optional data frame clade-level metadata. One column must named "clade". mapping Optional aesthetic mapping apply trees, returned `ggplot2::aes` function. Mapped variables can anything columns `data` node-wise data frame associated `ggtree` plot created (e.g. node, label, clade, mrca) anything columns clade-wise `metadata`, provided (case aesthetics mapped nodes within clade). xlen Length extra tips grafted tree island age. hack scaling plot. Keep value small. pargs Optional arguments passed `geom_point` plotting points colonization events (e.g. size, shape...). bckgd Optional background color figure. use rectangles hack hide tree branches prior island colonization. Default white background.

title: DAISIE tree plot — DAISIE_plot_input
text: `ggtree` plot, also `ggplot` object. output fully customizable, `ggplot` object.

title: DAISIE tree plot — DAISIE_plot_input
text: Raphael Scherrer (github.com/rscherrer)

title: DAISIE tree plot — DAISIE_plot_input
code: # check whether package tibble has been installed  if (!requireNamespace('tibble', quietly = TRUE)) {     cat("Package tibble needed for this function to work. Please install it.")  } else {  set.seed(42)   # Random trees  t1 <- ape::rtree(10)  t1$tip.label <- gsub("t", "t1.", t1$tip.label)  t2 <- ape::rtree(3)  t2$tip.label <- gsub("t", "t2.", t2$tip.label)  t3 <- ape::rtree(2)  trees <- list(t1, t2, t3)  names(trees) <- c("A", "B", "C")   # Toy colonization events for each clade  tcols <- c(4.5, 5, 4.6)   # Toy metadata  metadata <- tibble::tibble(    clade = names(trees),    endemic = TRUE,  # whether each clade is endemic    uncertain = FALSE  # whether colonization time is known for sure  )  metadata$endemic[3] <- FALSE  metadata$uncertain[2] <- TRUE   # Island age  age <- 5   # Make a plot  p <- DAISIE_plot_input(    trees,    age,    tcols,    metadata,    mapping = ggplot2::aes(color = endemic, linetype = uncertain),    pargs = list(size = 3)  ) p } #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. #> Joining with `by = join_by(label)` #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

DAISIE_probdist() DAISIE_margprobdist() either initprobs must NULL. what: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
text: function simulates islands given cladogenesis, extinction, Kprime, immigration anagenesis parameters, modelled time-constant parameters. single parameter set provided (5 parameters) simulates islands species macro-evolutionary process. two paramater sets (10 parameters) provided, simulates islands two different macro-evolutionary processes operate, one applying type 1 species type 2 species. , allows simulation non-oceanic islands, generating islands starting condition includes potential endemic non-endemic species.

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
code: DAISIE_sim_cr(   time,   M,   pars,   replicates,   divdepmodel = "CS",   nonoceanic_pars = c(0, 0),   num_guilds = NULL,   prop_type2_pool = NA,   replicates_apply_type2 = TRUE,   sample_freq = 25,   plot_sims = TRUE,   hyper_pars = create_hyper_pars(d = 0, x = 0),   area_pars = create_area_pars(max_area = 1, current_area = 1, proportional_peak_t = 0,     total_island_age = 0, sea_level_amplitude = 0, sea_level_frequency = 0,     island_gradient_angle = 0),   cond = 0,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
text: time Numeric defining length simulation time units. example, island known 4 million years old, setting time = 4 simulate entire life span island; setting time = 2 stop simulation mid-life island. M Numeric defining size mainland pool, .e. number species can potentially colonize island. pars numeric vector containing model parameters: pars[1]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars[2]: mu (extinction rate) pars[3]: K (carrying capacity), set K=Inf diversity   independence. pars[4]: gamma (immigration rate) pars[5]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars[6]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[7]: mu (extinction rate) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model pars[8]: K (carrying capacity) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model, set K=Inf diversity independence. pars[9]: gamma (immigration rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[10]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) either type 2   species rate set 2 rate shift model Elements 6:10 required type 2 species included rate shift model. DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. replicates Integer specifying number island replicates simulated. divdepmodel Option divdepmodel = 'CS' runs model clade-specific carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within single clades, .e. among species originating mainland colonist. Option divdepmodel = 'IW' runs model island-wide carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within among clades. Option divdepmodel = 'GW' runs model diversity-dependence operates within guild. nonoceanic_pars vector length two : [1]: probability sampling species mainland [2]: probability species sampled mainland   nonendemic num_guilds number guilds mainland. number mainland species divided number guilds divdepmodel = "GW" prop_type2_pool Fraction mainland species belongs second subset species (type 2). Applies two types species simulated (length(pars) = 10). DAISIE_dataprep() applies number_clade_types = 2.  DAISIE_dataprep() default "proportional" sets fraction proportional number clades distinct macroevolutionary process colonised island. replicates_apply_type2 Applies two types species simulated. Default replicates_apply_type2 = TRUE runs simulations number islands type 2 species colonised equal specified number replicates. recommended prop_type2_pool small rate immigration type two species (pars[9]) low, meaning replicates needed achieved adequate sample size islands type 2 species. Setting replicates_apply_type2 = FALSE simulates islands specified number replicates regardless whether type 2 species colonised . sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. plot_sims Default = TRUE plots species--time (STT) plots. detects many types species present. one type species present, STT plotted species. two types present, three plots produced: STT , STT type 1 STT type 2. hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island cond cond = 0 : conditioning island age  cond = 1 : conditioning island age non-extinction island biota . cond > 1 : conditioning island age least cond colonizations island. last option yet available IW model verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation. ... arguments pass plotting functions.

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
text: list. highest level least corresponds individual replciate. first element replicate composed island information containing: $island_age: numeric island age. $not_present: number mainland lineages     present island. present 1 type species     simulated. Becomes $not_present_type1: number mainland     lineages type 1 present island     $not_present_type2: number mainland lineages type 2     present island, two types simulated. $stt_all: STT table species island     (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species,     nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent     colonisations present) $stt_stt_type1: STT table type 1 species island -     2 types species simulated (nI - number non-endemic     species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic     species, present - number independent colonisations present). $stt_stt_type2: STT table type 2 species island      - 2 types species simulated (nI - number non-endemic      species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic      species, present - number independent colonisations present ). $brts_table: simulations "IW". Table containing information order events data, use maximum likelihood optimization.). subsequent elements list pertaining replcate contain information single colonist lineage island 4 components: $branching_times: island age stem age     population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge     Endemic anagenetic species.    cladogenetic species     island age branching times radiation including     stem age radiation. $stac: integer ranging 1 4   indicating status colonist: Non_endemic_MaxAge Endemic Endemic&Non_Endemic Non_endemic_MaxAge $missing_species: number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type_1or2: whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2

text: Valente, L.M., .B. Phillimore R.S. Etienne (2015). Equilibrium non-equilibrium dynamics simultaneously operate Galapagos islands. Ecology Letters 18: 844-852.

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
text: Luis Valente, Albert Phillimore, Joshua Lambert, Shu Xie, Pedro Neves, Richèl J. C. Bilderbeek, Rampal Etienne

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under time-constant rates — DAISIE_sim
code: ## Simulate 2 islands for 1 million years, where all species have equal ## rates. Pool size 100.  clado_rate <- 0.5 ext_rate <- 0.2 carr_cap <- Inf immig_rate <- 0.05 ana_rate <- 1 sim_pars <- c(clado_rate, ext_rate, carr_cap, immig_rate, ana_rate) set.seed(1) island_replicates <- DAISIE_sim_cr(   time = 1,   M = 100,   pars = sim_pars,   replicates = 2,   plot_sims = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )  ## Simulate 2 islands for 1 million years with two types of species (type1 ## and type 2). Pool size 100 ## Fraction of type 2 species in source pool is 0.15. Function will ## simulate until number of islands where type 2 species has colonised is ## equal to number specified in replicates.  clado_rate <- 0.5 ext_rate <- 0.2 carr_cap <- Inf immig_rate <- 0.005 ana_rate <- 1 sim_pars_type1 <- c(clado_rate, ext_rate, carr_cap, immig_rate, ana_rate) sim_pars_type2 <- sim_pars_type1 * 2 set.seed(1) island_replicates_2types <- DAISIE_sim_cr(   time = 1,   M = 100,   pars = c(sim_pars_type1, sim_pars_type2),   replicates = 2,   prop_type2_pool = 0.15,   plot_sims = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE ) ## Simulate two non-oceanic island for 1 million years. ## Pool size 500. Island area as a proportion ## of mainland is 0.1, proportion of native species is 0.9. clado_rate <- 0.5 ext_rate <- 0.2 carr_cap <- Inf immig_rate <- 0.005 ana_rate <- 1 sim_pars <- c(clado_rate, ext_rate, carr_cap, immig_rate, ana_rate) set.seed(1) island_replicates <- DAISIE_sim_cr(   time = 1,   M = 500,   pars = sim_pars,   replicates = 2,   nonoceanic_pars = c(0.1, 0.9),   plot_sims = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )  ## Simulate 2 islands for 1 million years with a shift in immigration rate ## at 0.195 Ma, and plot the species-through-time plot. Pool size 296.  pars_before_shift <- c(0.079, 0.973, Inf, 0.136, 0.413) pars_after_shift <- c(0.079, 0.973, Inf, 0.652, 0.413) tshift <- 0.195 set.seed(1) island_shift_replicates <- DAISIE_sim_cr_shift(   time = 1,   M = 296,   pars = c(pars_before_shift, pars_after_shift),   replicates = 2,   shift_times = tshift,   plot_sims = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

what: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
title: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
text: function simulates islands given age, area isolation. list islands/archipelagos information provided data frame object (example, archipelago_data Valente et al 2020 Nature). island, local parameters first calculated based hyperparameters describing dependency rates island area isolation. Simulations run island, island birth given island age based local parameters island (using DAISIE_sim function). Returns R list object contains simulated islands.

title: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
code: DAISIE_sim_MW(   archipelago_data,   M,   pars,   replicates,   divdepmodel = "CS",   distance_dep = "power",   cladogenesis_dep = "NULL",   sigmoidal_par = "NULL" )

title: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
text: archipelago_data Object (data.frame) containing table columns following names: Archipelago: names archipelagos islands simulated; Area - area archipelago/island; Age: Age oldest island archipelago, age island single island. Distance - distance mainland (applicable isolation metric). example, dataset Valente et al 2020 41 archipelagos provided data(archipelago_data). M size mainland pool, .e number species can potentially colonize island(s). pars Contains model hyperparameters: pars[1] corresponds lambda^c0 (initial cladogenesis rate) pars[2] corresponds y (dependency cladogenesis area) 0 - dependency, positive value - cladogenesis increases area, negative value - cladogenesis decreases area pars[3] corresponds mu_0 (initial extinction rate) pars[4] corresponds x (dependency extinction area) 0 - dependency, positive value - extinction increases area, negative value - extinction decreases area. pars[5] corresponds K_0  (initial carrying capacity). Set K=Inf non-diversity dependence. pars[6] corresponds z (dependency K area). 0 - dependency, positive value - K increases area, negative value - K decreases area. pars[7] corresponds gamma_0 (initial immigration rate) pars[8] corresponds alpha (dependency immigration island isolation). 0 - dependency, positive value - immigration increases distance, negative value - immigration decreases distance pars[9] corresponds lambda^a_0 (initial anagenesis rate) pars[10] corresponds beta (dependency anagenesis island isolation). 0 - dependency,positive value - anagenesis increases distance, negative value - anagenesis decreases distance. pars[11] corresponds d0, parameter describes interactive/additive effect isolation area cladogenesis (power models); describes shape sigmoidal relationship isolation parameter (sigmoidal models). replicates Number island replicates simulated per island table archipelago_data. 5 islands archipelago_data, number replicates set 10, 50 islands simulated. divdepmodel Option divdepmodel = 'CS' runs model clade-specific carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within single clades, .e. among species originating mainland colonist. Option divdepmodel = 'IW' runs model island-wide carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within among clades. distance_dep Shape dependency parameter distance. Can type  'power' type  'sigmoidal'. cladogenesis_dep distance_dep = 'power' specified, cladogenesis_dep specifies type effect area isolation cladogenesis. possible options :  'NULL' (additive interactive effect area isolation, models M1-M14 Valente et al 2020)  'additive' (additive effect area isolation cladogenesis, model M15 Valente et al 2020)  'interactive' (interactive effect area isolation cladogenesis, models M16 M19 Valente et al 2020)  'interactive1' (interactive effect area isolation cladogenesis, model M17 Valente et al 2020)  'interactive2' (interactive effect area isolation cladogenesis, model M18 Valente et al 2020) sigmoidal_par distance_dep = 'sigmoidal', sigmoidal_par specifies parameter sigmoidal relationship distance applied. Options:  'cladogenesis' 'anagenesis'  'colonisation'.

title: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
text: island listed rows archipelago_data, given number islands simulated depending number replicates specified. simulations island archipelago_data element list, can called using [[x]]. Individual replicates island can called [[x]][[x]] example object called global_sims, 1st replicate first island can called using global_sims[[1]][[1]]. 3rd replicate 4th island called global_sims[[4]][[3]] island replicates list . first (e.g. global_sims[[x]][[x]][[1]]) element list following components: $island_age - island archipelago age $not_present - number mainland lineages present island $stt_all - STT table species archipelago/island (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent colonisations present) $area Area island archipelago $distance Distance mainland $name Name island archipelago subsequent elements list contain information single colonist lineage island 4 components:$branching_times - island age stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge Endemic close extant relatives islands species. cladogenetic species island age branching times radiation including stem age radiation.$stac - status colonist  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades)

title: Simulate multiple islands based on hyperparameters that describe relationships between area, isolation and local parameters — DAISIE_sim_MW
code: ## Simulate 10 replicates for the each of the 41 archipelagos in the archipelago_data table, ##based on the hyperparameters of the M19 model (preferred model in Valente et al 2020) ## and the age, area and isolation values given in the archipelago_data table. ## Mainland pool size of 1000, clade-specific carrying capacity. The M19 model is a ## power model with an interactive effect of area and isolation on cladogenesis. ## ## data(archipelago_data) ## result <- DAISIE_sim_MW( ## archipelago_data = archipelago_data, ## M = 1000, ## pars = c(0.040073803,  0,  1.945656546,  0.150429656,  Inf,  0,  67.25643672, ## 0.293635061,  0.059096872,  0.382688527,  0.026510781), ## replicates = 10, ## distance_dep = 'power', ## cladogenesis_dep = 'interactive', ## sigmoidal_par = 'NULL', ## divdepmodel = 'CS')

title: Internal function of the DAISIE simulation — DAISIE_sim_core_cr
text: time Numeric defining length simulation time units. example, island known 4 million years old, setting time = 4 simulate entire life span island; setting time = 2 stop simulation mid-life island. mainland_n numeric stating number mainland species, number species can potentially colonize island. using clade-specific diversity dependence, value set 1. using island-wide diversity dependence, value set number mainland species. pars numeric vector containing model parameters: pars[1]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars[2]: mu (extinction rate) pars[3]: K (carrying capacity), set K=Inf diversity   independence. pars[4]: gamma (immigration rate) pars[5]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars[6]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[7]: mu (extinction rate) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model pars[8]: K (carrying capacity) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model, set K=Inf diversity independence. pars[9]: gamma (immigration rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[10]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) either type 2   species rate set 2 rate shift model Elements 6:10 required type 2 species included rate shift model. DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. nonoceanic_pars vector length two : [1]: probability sampling species mainland [2]: probability species sampled mainland   nonendemic hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island

title: Simulates island replicates with an clade-specific (CS) diversity-dependent constant-rate process — DAISIE_sim_cr_cs
text: total_time Numeric defining length simulation time units. M Numeric defining size mainland pool, .e. number species can potentially colonize island. pars numeric vector containing model parameters: pars[1]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars[2]: mu (extinction rate) pars[3]: K (carrying capacity), set K=Inf diversity   independence. pars[4]: gamma (immigration rate) pars[5]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars[6]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[7]: mu (extinction rate) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model pars[8]: K (carrying capacity) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model, set K=Inf diversity independence. pars[9]: gamma (immigration rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[10]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) either type 2   species rate set 2 rate shift model Elements 6:10 required type 2 species included rate shift model. DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. replicates Integer specifying number island replicates simulated. nonoceanic_pars vector length two : [1]: probability sampling species mainland [2]: probability species sampled mainland   nonendemic prop_type2_pool Fraction mainland species belongs second subset species (type 2). Applies two types species simulated (length(pars) = 10). DAISIE_dataprep() applies number_clade_types = 2.  DAISIE_dataprep() default "proportional" sets fraction proportional number clades distinct macroevolutionary process colonised island. replicates_apply_type2 Applies two types species simulated. Default replicates_apply_type2 = TRUE runs simulations number islands type 2 species colonised equal specified number replicates. recommended prop_type2_pool small rate immigration type two species (pars[9]) low, meaning replicates needed achieved adequate sample size islands type 2 species. Setting replicates_apply_type2 = FALSE simulates islands specified number replicates regardless whether type 2 species colonised . sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island cond cond = 0 : conditioning island age  cond = 1 : conditioning island age non-extinction island biota . cond > 1 : conditioning island age least cond colonizations island. last option yet available IW model verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation.

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under a relaxed-rate model — DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate
text: Luis Valente, Albert Phillimore, Joshua Lambert, Shu Xie, Pedro Neves, Richèl J. C. Bilderbeek, Rampal Etienne

title: Simulate (non-)oceanic islands with given parameters under a relaxed-rate model — DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate
code: ## Simulate an island for 1 million years, with a relaxed the rate of ## cladogenesis between clades. Pool size 500.  clado_rate <- 0.5 ext_rate <- 0.2 carr_cap <- Inf immig_rate <- 0.005 ana_rate <- 1 par_sd <- 1 sim_pars <- c(clado_rate, ext_rate, carr_cap, immig_rate, ana_rate, par_sd) set.seed(1) island_replicates <- DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate(   time = 1,   M = 500,   pars = sim_pars,   replicates = 2,   relaxed_par = "cladogenesis",   plot_sims = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. replicates Integer specifying number island replicates simulated. area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate nonoceanic_pars vector length two : [1]: probability sampling species mainland [2]: probability species sampled mainland   nonendemic num_guilds number guilds mainland. number mainland species divided number guilds divdepmodel = "GW" sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. island_ontogeny DAISIE_sim_time_dep(), DAISIE_ML_CS plotting string describing type island ontogeny. Can "const", "beta" beta function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type island ontogeny. Can 0 constant, 1 beta function describing area time. ML functions island_ontogeny = NA assumes constant ontogeny. Time dependent estimation yet available development still ongoing. return error called case. sea_level DAISIE_sim_time_dep() plotting string describing type sea level. Can "const" "sine" sine function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type sea level. Can 0 constant, 1 sine function describing area time. peak numeric value specifying peakiness (shaprness) ontogeny curve. Higher values imply peakier ontogeny. value internally calculated calc_peak() given area present area_pars. Amax numeric value maximum island area simulation. Amin numeric value minimum island area simulation. extcutoff numeric cutoff maximum extinction rate preventing large slowing simulation. verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation.

code: DAISIE_sim_trait_dep(   time,   M,   pars,   replicates,   divdepmodel = "CS",   sample_freq = 25,   plot_sims = TRUE,   island_ontogeny = "const",   sea_level = "const",   hyper_pars = create_hyper_pars(d = 0, x = 0),   area_pars = DAISIE::create_area_pars(max_area = 1, current_area = 1,     proportional_peak_t = 0, total_island_age = 0, sea_level_amplitude = 0,     sea_level_frequency = 0, island_gradient_angle = 0),   extcutoff = 1000,   cond = 0,   verbose = TRUE,   trait_pars = NULL,   ... )

title: Simulate islands with given trait-dependent parameters. — DAISIE_sim_trait_dep
text: time Numeric defining length simulation time units. example, island known 4 million years old, setting time = 4 simulate entire life span island; setting time = 2 stop simulation mid-life island. M Numeric defining size mainland pool, .e. number species can potentially colonize island. pars numeric vector containing model parameters: pars[1]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars[2]: mu (extinction rate) pars[3]: K (carrying capacity), set K=Inf diversity   independence. pars[4]: gamma (immigration rate) pars[5]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars[6]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[7]: mu (extinction rate) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model pars[8]: K (carrying capacity) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model, set K=Inf diversity independence. pars[9]: gamma (immigration rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[10]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) either type 2   species rate set 2 rate shift model Elements 6:10 required type 2 species included rate shift model. DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. replicates Integer specifying number island replicates simulated. divdepmodel Option divdepmodel = 'CS' runs model clade-specific carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within single clades, .e. among species originating mainland colonist. Option divdepmodel = 'IW' runs model island-wide carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within among clades. Option divdepmodel = 'GW' runs model diversity-dependence operates within guild. sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. plot_sims Default = TRUE plots species--time (STT) plots. detects many types species present. one type species present, STT plotted species. two types present, three plots produced: STT , STT type 1 STT type 2. island_ontogeny DAISIE_sim_time_dep(), DAISIE_ML_CS plotting string describing type island ontogeny. Can "const", "beta" beta function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type island ontogeny. Can 0 constant, 1 beta function describing area time. ML functions island_ontogeny = NA assumes constant ontogeny. Time dependent estimation yet available development still ongoing. return error called case. sea_level DAISIE_sim_time_dep() plotting string describing type sea level. Can "const" "sine" sine function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type sea level. Can 0 constant, 1 sine function describing area time. hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island extcutoff numeric cutoff maximum extinction rate preventing large slowing simulation. cond cond = 0 : conditioning island age  cond = 1 : conditioning island age non-extinction island biota . cond > 1 : conditioning island age least cond colonizations island. last option yet available IW model verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation. trait_pars named list containing diversification rates considering   two trait states created create_trait_pars: [1]:numeric per capita transition rate state1 [2]:numeric per capita immigration rate state2 [3]:numeric per capita extinction rate state2 [4]:numeric per capita anagenesis rate state2 [5]:numeric per capita cladogenesis rate state2 [6]:numeric per capita transition rate state2 [7]:numeric number species trait state 2    mainland ... arguments pass plotting functions.

title: Simulate islands with given trait-dependent parameters. — DAISIE_sim_trait_dep
text: list. highest level least corresponds individual replicate. first element replicate composed island information containing: $island_age: numeric island age. $not_present: numeric number mainland lineages   present island. $stt_all: STT table species island     (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species,     nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent     colonisations present) $brts_table: simulations "IW". Table containing information order events data, use maximum likelihood optimization.). subsequent elements list pertaining replcate contain information single colonist lineage island 4 components: $branching_times: island age stem age     population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge     Endemic anagenetic species. cladogenetic species     island age branching times radiation including     stem age radiation. $stac: integer ranging 1 4   indicating status colonist: $missing_species: number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type_1or2: whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2

what: Colonization and branching times of 8 terrestrial avifaunal clades in list format, accepted by DAISIE_ML and DAISIE_loglik_all — Galapagos_datalist
title: Colonization and branching times of 8 terrestrial avifaunal clades in list format, accepted by DAISIE_ML and DAISIE_loglik_all — Galapagos_datalist
text: list containing colonization branching times terrestrial avifauna Galapagos distinction made types colonists. list can generated using DAISIE_dataprep function, converts user-specified data table data object, object can course also entered directly. R list object following elements. first element list two components: $island_age - island age $not_present - number mainland lineages present island  following 8 elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age followed stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge species Endemic species close relatives island. endemic clades one species island (cladogenetic clades/ radiations) island age followed branching times island cladeincluding stem age clade.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2. dataset equal 1.

what: Colonization and branching times of 8 terrestrial avifaunal Galápagos clades in table format. — Galapagos_datatable
title: Colonization and branching times of 8 terrestrial avifaunal Galápagos clades in table format. — Galapagos_datatable
text: table containing colonization branching times terrestrial avifauna Galápagos. row table represents independent colonisation event. table four columns. $Clade_name - name independent colonization event $Status - One following categories:  * Non_endemic: non-endemic island species approximate time colonisation known  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: non-endemic island species colonisation time unknown  * Endemic: endemic species approximate colonisation time known  * "Endemic_MaxAge": applies endemic species endemic clades cases colonisation time unknown, user wants specify upper bound colonisation. example apply endemic species recently gone extinct anthropogenic causes, included phylogeny ("NA" given branching times column). also apply insular radiations long stem branches, time first cladogenetic event known, precise time colonisation . * Endemic&Non_Endemic: endemic clade mainland ancestor re-colonized $Missing_species - Number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades)$Branching_times - Stem age population/species case "Non_endemic",  "Non_endemic_MaxAge" "Endemic" species extant close relatives island.  Set "NA" colonisation time unknown upper bound known. "Endemic" cladogenetic species branching times radiation, including stem age radiation (colonisation time estimate).

text: list containing colonization branching times terrestrial avifauna 4 archipelagos: Azores, Canary Islands, Cape Verde Madeira. R list object 4 main elements corresponding archipelagos (e.g. Macaronesia_datalist[[1]] calls Azores data). four elements made several elemants: first element list archipelago two components: $island_age - island age $not_present - number mainland lineages present island  following elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age followed stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge species Endemic species close relatives island. endemic clades one species island (cladogenetic clades/ radiations) island age followed branching times island clade including stem age clade.  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1 * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4  * Endemic_MaxAge: 5 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2. dataset equal 1.

title: Colonization and branching times of terrestrial avifaunal clades from Azores, Canary Islands, Cape Verde and Madeira in list format, accepted by DAISIE_ML and DAISIE_loglik_all — Macaronesia_datalist
text: list 4 main elements archipelago. element several sub-elements.

title: Colonization and branching times of terrestrial avifaunal clades from Azores, Canary Islands, Cape Verde and Madeira in list format, accepted by DAISIE_ML and DAISIE_loglik_all — Macaronesia_datalist
text: Valente L., Illera J.C, Havenstein K., Pallien T., Etienne R.S., Tiedemann R. Equilibrium bird species diversity Atlantic islands. 2017 Current Biology, 27, 1660-1666.

what: Colonization and branching times of New Zealand birds. — NewZealand_birds_datalist
title: Colonization and branching times of New Zealand birds. — NewZealand_birds_datalist
text: list containing colonization branching times birds New Zealand. Main dataset used Valente, Etienne, Garcia-R (2019) Current Biology. Island age 52 Myr mainland pool size 1000 species.  first element list two components: $island_age - island age $not_present - number mainland lineages present island  following elements list contain information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age followed stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge species Endemic species close relatives island. endemic clades one species island (cladogenetic clades/ radiations) island age followed branching times island clade including stem age clade.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4  * Endemic_MaxAge: 5 6 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2. dataset equal 1.

title: Colonization and branching times of New Zealand birds. — NewZealand_birds_datalist

title: Colonization and branching times of New Zealand birds. — NewZealand_birds_datalist
text: Valente L, Etienne RS, Garcia-R JC (2019) Deep Macroevolutionary Impact Humans New Zealand’s Unique Avifauna. Current Biology, 29, 2563–2569.

text: proptime numeric 0 1. proportion time elapsed simulation, relation total island age (NB: simulation time, island age). proptime_max numeric 0 1. proportional_peak_t. Indicates, proportion total island age ontogeny peak occur (.e. 0.5 means peak halfway time). peak numeric value specifying peakiness (shaprness) ontogeny curve. title: Default parameter documentation — default_params_doc
text: time Numeric defining length simulation time units. example, island known 4 million years old, setting time = 4 simulate entire life span island; setting time = 2 stop simulation mid-life island. M Numeric defining size mainland pool, .e. number species can potentially colonize island. pars numeric vector containing model parameters: pars[1]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars[2]: mu (extinction rate) pars[3]: K (carrying capacity), set K=Inf diversity   independence. pars[4]: gamma (immigration rate) pars[5]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) pars[6]: lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[7]: mu (extinction rate) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model pars[8]: K (carrying capacity) either type 2 species rate   set 2 rate shift model, set K=Inf diversity independence. pars[9]: gamma (immigration rate) either type 2 species   rate set 2 rate shift model pars[10]: lambda^(anagenesis rate) either type 2   species rate set 2 rate shift model Elements 6:10 required type 2 species included rate shift model. DAISIE_sim_relaxed_rate() pars[6] standard deviation gamma distribution relaxed parameter parameter chosen relaxed_par argument mean gamma distribution relaxed parameter. replicates Integer specifying number island replicates simulated. divdepmodel Option divdepmodel = 'CS' runs model clade-specific carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within single clades, .e. among species originating mainland colonist. Option divdepmodel = 'IW' runs model island-wide carrying capacity, diversity-dependence operates within among clades. Option divdepmodel = 'GW' runs model diversity-dependence operates within guild. nonoceanic_pars vector length two : [1]: probability sampling species mainland [2]: probability species sampled mainland   nonendemic num_guilds number guilds mainland. number mainland species divided number guilds divdepmodel = "GW" prop_type2_pool Fraction mainland species belongs second subset species (type 2). Applies two types species simulated (length(pars) = 10). DAISIE_dataprep() applies number_clade_types = 2.  DAISIE_dataprep() default "proportional" sets fraction proportional number clades distinct macroevolutionary process colonised island. replicates_apply_type2 Applies two types species simulated. Default replicates_apply_type2 = TRUE runs simulations number islands type 2 species colonised equal specified number replicates. recommended prop_type2_pool small rate immigration type two species (pars[9]) low, meaning replicates needed achieved adequate sample size islands type 2 species. Setting replicates_apply_type2 = FALSE simulates islands specified number replicates regardless whether type 2 species colonised . sample_freq Numeric specifing number units times divided plotting purposes. Larger values lead plots higher resolution, also run slower. plot_sims Default = TRUE plots species--time (STT) plots. detects many types species present. one type species present, STT plotted species. two types present, three plots produced: STT , STT type 1 STT type 2. verbose numeric vector length 1, simulations `DAISIEdataprep()` can `1` `0`, `1` gives intermediate output printed. ML functions numeric determining intermediate output printed. default: `0` print, `1` prints initial likelihood settings selected (parameters optimised, fixed shifted), `2` prints `1 also intermediate output parameters loglikelihood, `3` `2` prints intermediate progress likelihood computation. area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate island_ontogeny DAISIE_sim_time_dep(), DAISIE_ML_CS plotting string describing type island ontogeny. Can "const", "beta" beta function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type island ontogeny. Can 0 constant, 1 beta function describing area time. ML functions island_ontogeny = NA assumes constant ontogeny. Time dependent estimation yet available development still ongoing. return error called case. sea_level DAISIE_sim_time_dep() plotting string describing type sea level. Can "const" "sine" sine function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type sea level. Can 0 constant, 1 sine function describing area time. extcutoff numeric cutoff maximum extinction rate preventing large slowing simulation. shift_times numeric vector specifying rate shifts occur present. mainland_n numeric stating number mainland species, number species can potentially colonize island. using clade-specific diversity dependence, value set 1. using island-wide diversity dependence, value set number mainland species. island_replicates List output DAISIE_sim_core_cr(), DAISIE_sim_core_time_dep(), DAISIE_sim_core_cr_shift() DAISIE_sim_min_type2() functions. Minimally, must list many elements replicates. element must list elements island_age, not_present stt_all. stt_all must data frame column names Time, nI, nA, nC present. island_spec Matrix current state simulation containing number species. stt_table Matrix number species time step. rates named list numeric rates returned update_rates(). max_rates named list numeric max rates returned update_max_rates(). timeval Numeric defining current time simulation. total_time Numeric defining length simulation time units. possible_event Numeric defining event happen. maxspecID Current species IDs. mainland_spec Number mainland species. max_area Numeric defining maximum area. proportional_peak_t Numeric value 0 1 indicating island's history peak area achieved. total_island_age Numeric defining total island age. sea_level_amplitude Numeric defining amplitude area fluctuation sea level. sea_level_frequency Numeric defining frequency sine wave area change sea level. island_gradient_angle Numeric defining angle degrees specifying slope island. d Numeric defining scaling parameter exponent calculating cladogenesis rate. x Numeric defining exponent calculating extinction rate. simulation_outputs list matrices vectors simulation produced DAISIE_sim functions. plot_plus_one Boolean indicate plot values plus one. Set TRUE default behavior. Set FALSE plot values without adding one. works one type species. type String indicate stt species possible stt plotted. Default "all_species", "type1_species" "type2_species" plotted. plot_lists List lists containing average quantile species time. ... arguments pass plotting functions. datalist Data object containing information colonisation branching times. object can generated using DAISIE_dataprep function, converts user-specified data table data object, object can course also entered directly. R list object following elements. first element list two three components: $island_age - island age  , depending whether distinction types made, :$not_present - number mainland lineages present island  :$not_present_type1 - number mainland lineages type 1 present island $not_present_type2 - number mainland lineages type 2 present island  remaining elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age followed stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge species Endemic species close relatives island. endemic clades one species island (cladogenetic clades/ radiations) island age followed branching times island clade including stem age clade$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_Endemic: 4  * Endemic_Singleton_MaxAge: 5  * Endemic_Clade_MaxAge: 6  * Endemic&Non_Endemic_Clade_MaxAge: 7 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2 datatype Sets type data: 'single' single island archipelago treated one, 'multiple' multiple archipelagoes potentially sharing parameters. initparsopt initial values parameters must optimized, positive. idparsopt ids parameters must optimized. ids defined follows:  id = 1 corresponds lambda^c (cladogenesis rate)  id = 2 corresponds mu (extinction rate)  id = 3 corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity)  id = 4 corresponds gamma (immigration rate)  id = 5 corresponds lambda^(anagenesis rate)  id = 6 corresponds lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) optional subset species  id = 7 corresponds mu (extinction rate) optional subset species id = 8 corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity) optional subset species id = 9 corresponds gamma (immigration rate) optional subset species id = 10 corresponds lambda^(anagenesis rate) optional subset species id = 11 corresponds p_f (fraction mainland species belongs second subset species. idparsfix ids parameters optimized, e.g. c(1,3) lambda^c K optimized. parsfix values parameters optimized. idparsnoshift datatype = 'single' : ids parameters different two groups species; can apply ids 6:10, e.g. idparsnoshift = c(6,7) means lambda^c mu values groups. idparsmat datatype = 'multiple' : Matrix containing ids parameters, linking initparsopt parsfix. Per island system use following order:  * lac = (initial) cladogenesis rate  * mu = extinction rate  * K = maximum number species possible clade  * gam = (initial) immigration rate  * laa = (initial) anagenesis rate  Example: idparsmat = rbind(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), c(1, 2, 3, 6, 7)) different rates immigration anagenesis two islands. res Sets maximum number species probability must computed, must larger size largest clade. ddmodel Sets model diversity-dependence:  ddmodel = 0 : diversity dependence  ddmodel = 1 : linear dependence speciation rate  ddmodel = 11: linear dependence speciation rate immigration rate  ddmodel = 2 : exponential dependence speciation rate ddmodel = 21: exponential dependence speciation rate immigration rate cond cond = 0 : conditioning island age  cond = 1 : conditioning island age non-extinction island biota . cond > 1 : conditioning island age least cond colonizations island. last option yet available IW model eqmodel Sets equilibrium constraint can used likelihood optimization. available datatype = 'single'. eqmodel = 0 : equilibrium assumed  eqmodel = 13 : near-equilibrium assumed endemics using deterministic equation endemics immigrants. Endemics must within x_E equilibrium value eqmodel = 15 : near-equilibrium assumed endemics immigrants using deterministic equation endemics immigrants. Endemics must within x_E equilibrium value, non-endemics must within x_I equilibrium value. x_E Sets fraction equlibrium endemic diversity endemics assumed equilibrium; active eqmodel = 13 15. x_I Sets fraction equlibrium non-endemic diversity system assumed equilibrium; active eqmodel = 15. tol Sets tolerances optimization. Consists :  reltolx = relative tolerance parameter values optimization  reltolf = relative tolerance function value optimization  abstolx = absolute tolerance parameter values optimization. maxiter Sets maximum number iterations optimization. methode Method ODE-solver. Supported Boost ODEINT solvers (steppers) : "odeint::runge_kutta_cash_karp54" "odeint::runge_kutta_fehlberg78" "odeint::runge_kutta_dopri5" "odeint::bulirsch_stoer" without odeint::-prefix, ode method assumed. default method overall "lsodes" DAISIE_ML_CS() "ode45" ode() DAISIE_ML_IW(). optimmethod Method used likelihood optimization. Default `subplex` (see `subplex()` full details). Alternative "simplex" method previous versions. CS_version numeric list. Default 1 standard DAISIE model, relaxed-rate model list following elements: model: CS model run, options 1 single rate   DAISIE model, 2 multi-rate DAISIE, 0 IW test   model. relaxed_par: parameter relax (integrate ). Options "cladogenesis", "extinction", "carrying_capacity", "immigration", "anagenesis". tolint Vector two elements containing absolute relative tolerance integration. datatable Data frame (table) user-specified data. See file Galapagos_datatable template input table. row table represents independent colonisation event. Table following four columns. $Clade_name - name independent colonization event $Status - One following categories:  * "Non_endemic": applies non-endemic species cases island non-island populations species sampled)  * "Non_endemic_MaxAge": applies non-endemic species cases island individuals species sampled age species available)  * "Endemic": applies endemic species applicable cladogenetic anagenetic species  * "Endemic_MaxAge": applies endemic species cases island individuals species sampled age species available. apply endemic species recently gone extinct antropogenic causes (evidently) modelled, DNA data available. * "Endemic&Non_Endemic": endemic clade present mainland ancestor re-colonized $Missing_species - Number island species sampled particular clade (applicable "Endemic" clades) $Branching_times - Stem age population/species case "Non-endemic", "Non-endemic_MaxAge" "Endemic" anagenetic species. "Endemic" cladogenetic species branching times radiation including stem age radiation. island_age Age island appropriate units. DAISIE_plot_age_diversity() DAISIE_plot_island() island input table format, age island must specified. island input DAISIE list format, option override island age specified island list. number_clade_types Number clade types. Default: number_clade_types = 1 species considered belong macroevolutionary process. number_clade_types = 2, two types clades distinct macroevolutionary processes. list_type2_clades number_clade_types = 2, list_type2_clades specifies names clades distinct macroevolutionary process. names must match $Clade_name column source data table (e.g. list_type2_clades = "Finches").  number_clade_types = 1, list_type2_clades = NA specified (default). epss Default= 1E-5 appropriate cases. value used set maximum age colonisation "Non_endemic_MaxAge" "Endemic_MaxAge" species age slightly younger island cases age provided species older island. new maximum age used upper bound integrate . t time expectations need computed. initEI initial values number endemics   non-endemics. DAISIE_probdist() DAISIE_margprobdist() either initprobs must NULL. DAISIE_numcol() NULL, assumed island   empty. data_table data table endmc Numeric many simulations run. archipelago something phylo_data something archipelago_data something gam numeric per capita immigration rate. laa numeric per capita anagenesis rate. lac numeric per capita cladogenesis rate. mu numeric per capita extinction rate. K numeric carrying capacity. num_spec numeric current number species. num_immigrants numeric current number non-endemic species (.k.non-endemic species). global_min_area_time stub global_max_area_time stub distance_type Use 'continent' distance continent used, use 'nearest_big' distance nearest big landmass used, use 'biologically_realistic' distance take account biologically realism, e.g. average previous two thought contribute. distance_dep Sets type distance dependence used. Default power law, denoted 'power'. Alternatives exponantial relationship denoted 'exp' sigmoids, either 'sigmoidal_col' sigmoid colonization, 'sigmoidal_ana' sigmoidal anagenesis, 'sigmoidal_clado' sigmoidal cladogenesis, 'sigmoidal_col_ana' signoids colonization anagenesis. parallel Sets whether parallel computation used. Use '' parallel computing used, 'cluster' parallel computing unix/linux cluster, 'local' parallel computation local machine. cpus Number cpus used parallel computing. Default 3. effect parallel = ''. pars1 Vector model parameters: pars1[1] corresponds lambda^c (cladogenesis rate) pars1[2] corresponds mu (extinction rate) pars1[3] corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity) pars1[4] corresponds gamma (immigration rate) pars1[5] corresponds lambda^(anagenesis rate). pars2 Vector settings: pars2[1] corresponds res, maximum number endemics non-endemics ODE system solved; must much larger actual number probability needs calculated.) pars2[2] corresponds M, size mainland pool, .e number species can potentially colonize island. tvec times probabilities need computed. initprobs initial probability distribution number endemics non-endemics; either initEI must NULL. pb Probability distribution matrix format output DAISIE_probdist(). island Island data object. Can DAISIE list format (see Galapagos_datalist DAISIE_data_prep examples) table format (see Galapagos_datatable example). title Title plot plot_lists_simulations List simulation output parsing DAISIE_prepare_data_plotting. plot_lists_simulations_MLE List simulation output parsing DAISIE_prepare_data_plotting, obtained simulating MLE output. kind_of_plot Character vector stating STT plot resulting MLE based simulations plotted. Default "line" multiple individual lines. Can also "shade" 5% quantile. resolution numeric indicating resolution plot. < 0. resol numeric resolution summary stats calculation. > 1. removed_timepoints Positive integer number first datapoints removed rate plots (prevent Inf) numeric value island area given point time. Amin numeric value minimum island area simulation. Amax numeric value maximum island area simulation. peak numeric value specifying peakiness (shaprness) ontogeny curve. Higher values imply peakier ontogeny. value internally calculated calc_peak() given area present area_pars. proptime numeric 0 1. proportion time elapsed simulation, relation total island age (NB: simulation time, island age). proptime_max numeric 0 1. proportional_peak_t. Indicates, proportion total island age ontogeny peak occur (.e. 0.5 means peak halfway time). current_area numeric current island area present (.e., end simulation). jitter Numeric optimizer(). Jitters parameters optimized specified amount small, e.g. 1e-5. Jitter link{subplex}{subplex}() produces incorrect output due parameter transformation. num_cycles number cycles optimizer go . Default 1. function_to_optimize one can indicate use function ('DAISIE_approx') approximates DAISIE likelihood default value 'DAISIE_exact'). approximate likelihood can example used case exact one fails. still development. trait_pars named list containing diversification rates considering   two trait states created create_trait_pars: [1]:numeric per capita transition rate state1 [2]:numeric per capita immigration rate state2 [3]:numeric per capita extinction rate state2 [4]:numeric per capita anagenesis rate state2 [5]:numeric per capita cladogenesis rate state2 [6]:numeric per capita transition rate state2 [7]:numeric number species trait state 2    mainland relaxed_par string determining parameter relaxed relaxed rate model. relaxed_rate_pars list two numbers, element one distribution mean, element two distribution standard deviation (sd). Currently distribution gamma distribution. list can created create_relaxed_rate_pars(). brts Numeric vector branching times stac Numeric Endemicity status missnumspec Numeric missing species DAISIE_par numeric parameter evaluate integral function. DAISIE_dist_pars numeric vector two elements, first mean second standard deviation distribution. abstolint Numeric absolute tolerance integration reltolint Numeric relative tolerance integration pick Numeric determining parameter selected relaxed-rate model mean Numeric mean distribution sd Numeric standard deviation distribution clado_rate Numeric rate cladogenesis ext_rate Numeric rate extinction carr_cap Numeric carrying capacity immig_rate Numeric rate immigration ana_rate Numeric rate anagenesis islands Island datalist simulated data DAISIE datalist format. Can single island (empirical data) generated DAISIE_dataprep DAISIEprep. Can also simulated data generated DAISIE_sim function. sort_clade_sizes Default sort_clade_sizes = T outputs clade sizes sorted ascending order number species. sort_clade_sizes=F outputs clade sizes order appear input datalist.

R list object following elements. first element list two components: $island_age - island age $not_present - number mainland lineages present island  following elements list contains information single colonist lineage island 5 components:$colonist_name - name species clade colonized island $branching_times - island age followed stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge species Endemic species close relatives island. endemic clades one species island (cladogenetic clades/ radiations) island age followed branching times island clade including stem age clade.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4  * Endemic_MaxAge: 5 6 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2. dataset equal 1.

title: 1000 islands in DAISIE format simulated with the ML parameters of the CR_lamc_mu_K model for the Galapagos data (2 types of species) — islands_2types_1000reps
text: simulated dataset element list, can called using e.g. islands_2types_1000reps[[1]] island replicates list . first (e.g. islands_2types_1000reps[[x]][[1]]) element list following components: $island_age - island age$not_present_type1 - number mainland lineages type 1 present island $not_present_type2 - number mainland lineages type 2 present island $stt_all - STT table species island (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent colonisations present )$stt_stt_type1 - STT table type 1 species island (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent colonisations present )$stt_stt_type2 - STT table type 2 species island (nI - number non-endemic species; nA - number anagenetic species, nC - number cladogenetic species, present - number independent colonisations present ) subsequent elements list contain information single colonist lineage island 4 components:$branching_times - island age stem age population/species case Non-endemic, Non-endemic_MaxAge Endemic anagenetic species. cladogenetic species island age branching times radiation including stem age radiation.$stac - status colonist  * Non_endemic_MaxAge: 1  * Endemic: 2  * Endemic&Non_Endemic: 3  * Non_endemic: 4 $missing_species - number island species sampled particular clade (applicable endemic clades) $type_1or2 - whether colonist belongs type 1 type 2

title: Calculates algorithm rates — update_rates
text: timeval Numeric defining current time simulation. total_time Numeric defining length simulation time units. gam numeric per capita immigration rate. laa numeric per capita anagenesis rate. lac numeric per capita cladogenesis rate. mu numeric per capita extinction rate. hyper_pars named list numeric hyperparameters rate calculations returned create_hyper_pars(): [1]: d scaling parameter exponent calculating   cladogenesis rate [2]: x exponent calculating extinction rate area_pars named list containing area sea level parameters created create_area_pars(): [1]: maximum area [2]: current area [3]: value 0 1 indicating island's history   peak area achieved [4]: total island age [5]: amplitude area fluctuation sea level [6]: frequency sine wave area change sea level [7]: angle slope island peak numeric value specifying peakiness (shaprness) ontogeny curve. Higher values imply peakier ontogeny. value internally calculated calc_peak() given area present area_pars. island_ontogeny DAISIE_sim_time_dep(), DAISIE_ML_CS plotting string describing type island ontogeny. Can "const", "beta" beta function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type island ontogeny. Can 0 constant, 1 beta function describing area time. ML functions island_ontogeny = NA assumes constant ontogeny. Time dependent estimation yet available development still ongoing. return error called case. sea_level DAISIE_sim_time_dep() plotting string describing type sea level. Can "const" "sine" sine function describing area time.  functions numeric describing type sea level. Can 0 constant, 1 sine function describing area time. extcutoff numeric cutoff maximum extinction rate preventing large slowing simulation. K numeric carrying capacity. num_spec numeric current number species. num_immigrants numeric current number non-endemic species (.k.non-endemic species). mainland_n numeric stating number mainland species, number species can potentially colonize island. using clade-specific diversity dependence, value set 1. using island-wide diversity dependence, value set number mainland species. trait_pars named list containing diversification rates considering   two trait states created create_trait_pars: [1]:numeric per capita transition rate state1 [2]:numeric per capita immigration rate state2 [3]:numeric per capita extinction rate state2 [4]:numeric per capita anagenesis rate state2 [5]:numeric per capita cladogenesis rate state2 [6]:numeric per capita transition rate state2 [7]:numeric number species trait state 2    mainland island_spec Matrix current state simulation containing number species.
